titles.title: Permitting the use of the Rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony to present posthumously a gold medal on behalf of Congress to Charles M. Schulz.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Mr. Ehlers asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 6/5/2001--Passed House without amendment. Authorizes use of the Rotunda of the Capitol on June 7, 2001, for a ceremony to present posthumously a congressional gold medal to Charles M. Schulz (creator of the Peanuts comic strip).
